Here K is the total number of cases over a wave of infections, r is the per capita growth rate of the cumulative case number, a is the exponent of deviation of the cumulative case curve, and t
i is the outbreak turning point of the cumulative epidemic wave, or the peak time of the outbreak incidence, signifying the moment of upturn or downturn for the temporal increase in cumulative case number. The Richards model has been applied extensively to model many infectious disease outbreaks [ 17– 26].
